body_html:
Usually a feature like this will involve several files. The best thing to do is to look at a similar op (say, transpose, maybe), and find all the files that have to be touched for that op.

There will be at least some files in core/ops, core/kernels, and python/kernel_tests, plus the BUILD files.

If the op is a pure python op, you may get away with only changing/adding a file in python/ops. This is probably not a python op, unless I'm missing a simple way to construct it from existing ops.

There will be at least some files in core/ops, core/kernels, and python/kernel_tests, plus the BUILD files.
If the op is a pure python op, you may get away with only changing/adding a file in python/ops. This is probably not a python op, unless I'm missing a simple way to construct it from existing ops.
body:
Usually a feature like this will involve several files. The best thing to do is to look at a similar op (say, `transpose`, maybe), and find all the files that have to be touched for that op.

There will be at least some files in core/ops, core/kernels, and python/kernel_tests, plus the BUILD files.

If the op is a pure python op, you may get away with only changing/adding a file in python/ops. This is probably not a python op, unless I'm missing a simple way to construct it from existing ops.
